Message.Title: System configuration
Message.Description: Mechanical Unit is defined in more than one RAPID program.
Message.Actions:
Check the configuration file.
I-start the system with correct parameters.

Message.Title: Process failed
Message.Description:
Task:
A process in the task has failed. This is caused by a failure of a process in this task or a synchronized task if MultiMove is used.
Message.Actions:
Check other messages occurring at the same time for the reason.
Recovery:

Message.Title: Record not ready
Message.Description: Record not ready to activate
Message.Actions:
Make sure that record is finished before activating.
Check sensor_start_signal

Message.Title: Unknown record file name
Message.Description: Record file name: is unknown.
Message.Actions:
Check file name or existence with file manager.
Record a new file

Message.Title: Cannot activate Mechanical Unit
Message.Description: The Mechanical Unit cannot be activated because it is not connected to a RAPID task.
Message.Actions: Check that the connection between Mechanical Unit and RAPID task is done correctly in the Controller configuration.

Message.Title: DitherAct not possible
Message.Description: Dithering is not possible to activate.
Message.Actions: Verify that a joint that can be used with DitherAct is chosen.

Message.Title: Mix of coordinated frames
Message.Description:
Task:
More than one unit move frames, reason :
1 It is not allowed to have a chain of coordinated frames.
2 It is not allowed to exchange the unit that control the frame in a cornerzone.
Program Ref.
Message.Actions:
1 Rearrange the units so that all units, which perform coordinated movements, are following the same unit.
2 Insert a finepoint or a not coordinated movement between the two coordinated movements.

Message.Title: Unit not stopped in a controlled position
Message.Description: The robot is semi coordinated to Unit from another task and the Unit has been moved or the regain to the path failed.
Message.Consequences: Program run or restart will be interrupted.
Message.Actions:
Check all programs that the semi coordinated movement is separated with finepoints and WaitSyncTask instructions before and after the movement and that the Unit is not moved between. Note that WaitSyncTask also is needed after the semi coordination before SyncMoveOn and SyncMoveResume.
Check that the Unit is moved to the wanted position before the semi coordinated movement. After SyncMoveOff, SyncMoveSuspend, ActUnit, DeactUnit or ClearPath the Unit must be moved (with a new movement instruction) to a position to define the frame so the other task can read it. The position can be a new position, or the current position of the Unit.
Check if the program for the Unit is active in the task selection panel.

Message.Title: Sync ID mismatch
Message.Description:
The specified id number for the move instruction has to be equal for all cooperating program tasks.
Current id number mismatch , .
Message.Actions: Verify that the specified id numbers are equal and that all PP are synchronized before program start.

Message.Title: Point type mismatch at sync
Message.Description: The move instructions with syncId = , have a mix between finepoints and zonepoints.
Message.Actions: Make sure that the move instruction in all cooperating program tasks specifies the same kind of point type, either finepoints or zonepoints.

Message.Title: Service unavailable
Message.Description: Unable to obtain correct license.
Message.Actions: Please check the license settings.

Message.Title: Transmission error of data
Message.Description: Transmission of data between cabinet and SMB-memory has failed.
Message.Causes: Cable, or transmission electronics failed. Electrical interference high.
Message.Actions:
- Restart try once more.
- Check cables.
- Check SMB-board.
- Check drive module.

Message.Title: Motion data missing
Message.Description: Data in SMB- and cabinet memory missing for mechanical unit .
Message.Causes: Configuration file missing. New SMB-board together with new cabinet.
Message.Actions: - Load new configuration files.

Message.Title: SMB memory data difference
Message.Description: Data in SMB memory is not same as in cabinet for mechanical unit .
Message.Causes: Not the same data or serial number in SMB memory and cabinet. Manipulator (SMB module) or cabinet exchanged or configuration parameters changed.
Message.Actions:
Check status via teach pendant and check if right configuration data (serial number) loaded in cabinet. Check that serial number belongs to the manipulator connected to the cabinet. If not, replace configuration files or manually transfer data from SMB memory to cabinet if cabinet has been exchanged.
If Serial Measurement Board replaced with board from another manipulator (serial numbers not the same), clear first SMB memory via teach pendant and then transfer data from cabinet to SMB.

Message.Title: Memory updated in SMB
Message.Description: Data for mechanical unit is moved from cabinet to SMB-memory.

Message.Title: Memory updated in cabinet
Message.Description: Data for mechanical unit is moved from SMB-memory to cabinet.

Message.Title: Speed control warning
Message.Description:
Speed for Unit is reduced due to limiting Unit .
Task: Instruction line:
Message.Causes: Programmed speed too high on this Unit or movement too long on limiting Unit
Message.Actions:
Change path or programmed speed .
Set speed control off

Message.Title: SMB memory not used
Message.Description: SMB-memory is not used for this mechanical unit.
Message.Causes: Additional axes can't and should not use the SMB-memory.

Message.Title: All SMB data missing
Message.Description: All data is missing in SMB-memory at board , link , drive module .
Message.Causes: An error in SMB-memory or communication has occurred. The data has been cleared.
Message.Actions: If proper data exists in cabinet - transfer the data to SMB-memory. If still problem - check communication cable to SMB-board. Replace SMB-board.

Message.Title: Sensor data missing
Message.Description: No serial number is defined for mechanical unit in SMB-memory.
Message.Causes: The SMB-memory has been cleared or new SMB-board has been installed.
Message.Actions: If proper data exists in cabinet - transfer the data to SMB-memory.

Message.Title: Cabinet data missing
Message.Description: No serial number is defined for mechanical unit in cabinet.
Message.Causes: The cabinet memory has been cleared or new cabinet has been installed..
Message.Actions: If proper data exists in SMB-memory - transfer the data to cabinet memory.

Message.Title: Old SMB board used
Message.Description: Old SMB board used without data memory.
Message.Actions: Replace board with a new with data memory or set parameter "Use old SMB" in configuration MOTION/ROBOT.

Message.Title: Load identification error
Message.Description: Cannot perform load identification because configuration angle makes inertia matrix singular.
Message.Actions: - Move axis 6 on the robot about 30 degrees in any direction.

Message.Title: Extended working range
Message.Description:
The option Extended working range has been installed.
Make sure that the mechanical stop has been removed.

Message.Title: In Position timeout
Message.Description: Condition for finepoint not fulfilled within seconds.
Message.Actions: Check tuning of additional axes, In Position Conditions (In Position Range, Zero Speed) and check if disturbance of resolver cables.

Message.Title: AbsAcc error
Message.Description: Data moved from SMB-memory to cabinet. AbsAcc data not valid in SMB-memory. AbsAcc cleared in cabinet for mechanical unit .
Message.Actions: Load new AbsAcc data if data available.

Message.Title: Independent joint not active
Message.Description: Mechanical unit with independent joint is not active.
Message.Actions: Activate the mechanical unit before executing the independent joint instruction.

Message.Title: Cannot activate Mechanical Unit in task
Message.Description: The Mechanical Unit cannot be activated in specified task.
Message.Actions: Check the connection between Mechanical Unit and RAPID task in the Controller configuration.

Message.Title: Mechanical Unit already active in other task
Message.Description: Cannot activate Mechanical Unit , since it is already active in another RAPID task.

Message.Title: Independent move reset failed
Message.Description: Independent reset movement failed for , a synchronized movement (MoveL/MoveJ) of the servo tool occurred during the independent reset movement.
Message.Actions: Make sure the synchronized speed of the servo tool is zero during execution of independent reset movements.

Message.Title: Independent move outside reach
Message.Description: Programmed independent move position for is outside reach. Programmed position = mm.
Message.Actions:
Adjust independent move position.
Check working range of the servo tool.

Message.Title: Corner path failure
Message.Description:
Task:
Interpolation and process stopped before the corner path due to some of the following reasons:
- Time delay.
- Closely programmed points.
- System requires high CPU-load.
Message.Actions:
- Reduce the number of instructions between consecutive move instructions.
- Reduce speed, use wider spaced points, use /CONC option.
- Increase ipol_prefetch_time.
Recovery:

Message.Title: Absolute accuracy not activated
Message.Description: Absolute accuracy function not activated.
Message.Consequences: Robot positioning will not be absolute accurate.
Message.Actions:
1. Switch AbsAcc on by changing Robot system parameter Use Robot Calibration to calib.
Verify status in jogging window.
2. Also make sure that absacc.cfg is loaded into controller memory.
Verify that data exists in a backup.

Message.Title: Disconnecting the Drive Module not allowed
Message.Description: An attempt was made to disconnect drive module , which is not allowed.
Message.Consequences: The system goes to state Motors OFF, and then disconnects the Drive Module.
Message.Causes: Disconnecting drive modules is only allowed in the Motors OFF state.
Message.Actions: Make sure that the system is in Motors OFF state before disconnecting the Drive Module.

Message.Title: Reconnecting the Drive Module not allowed
Message.Description: Drive Module should not be reconnected since the system is not in the state Motors OFF.
Message.Consequences: An attempt was made to reconnect drive module , which is not allowed.
Message.Causes: Reconnecting drive modules is only allowed in the Motors OFF status.
Message.Actions: Make sure that the system is in Motors OFF state before reconnecting the Drive Module.

Message.Title: Cannot activate Mechanical Unit
Message.Description: An attempt was made to activate mechanical unit , which failed.
Message.Causes: The mechanical unit is connected to Drive Module which is disconnected.
Message.Actions: 1) Reconnect the Drive Module. 2) Retry to activate the Mechanical Unit.

Message.Title: Drive Module has been disconnected
Message.Description: Drive Module has been disconnected.
Message.Consequences: No mechanical units connected to the drive module may be operated.

Message.Title: Drive Module has been reconnected
Message.Description: Drive Module has been reconnected after being disconnected.
Message.Consequences: All mechanical units connected to drive module may be operated.

Message.Title: Mechanical Unit not connected to Motion task
Message.Description: Cannot activate Mechanical Unit , since it is not connected to any Motion task.
Message.Actions: Check the connection between Mechanical Unit and RAPID task in the Controller configuration.

Message.Title: Failed to read force sensor
Message.Description: Failed to return calibrated force sensor reading.
Message.Causes: Force control system not calibrated.
Message.Actions: Use the instruction FCCalib before using this instruction.

Message.Title: Force control calibration failed
Message.Description: Failed to calibrate the force control system.
Message.Causes: The system is not in position control.
Message.Actions: Make sure the robot is in position control mode before using the FCCalib instruction.

Message.Title: Failed to activate force control
Message.Description: Activation of force control failed.
Message.Causes: The system is either not calibrated or we are already in force control. Another reason for this could be incorrect arguments.
Message.Actions: Only use the FCAct or FCPress1LStart instruction when the force control system is calibrated and we are in position control. Check all arguments to the activation instruction.

Message.Title: Failed to deactivate force control
Message.Description: Failed to return to position control.
Message.Causes: Can not set position control if the robot is moving due to external forces or ordered references.
Message.Actions: Stop any active references and remove any external forces and try again.

Message.Title: Failed to start references
Message.Description: Failed to start the user specified references
Message.Causes: Only allowed to start references when in force control.
Message.Actions: Must activate force control before trying to start references.

Message.Title: Parameter error in FCRefSprForce or FCRefSprTorque
Message.Description: Error in parameter Stiffness in instruction FCRefSprForce or FCRefSprTorque.
Message.Actions: Change the parameter Stiffness in instruction FCRefSprForce or FCRefSprTorque to a value larger than zero.

Message.Title: Parameter error in FCRefSprForce
Message.Description: Error in parameter MaxForce in instruction FCRefSprForce.
Message.Actions: Change the parameter MaxForce in instruction FCRefSprForce to a value larger than zero.

Message.Title: Parameter error in FCRefSprTorque
Message.Description: Error in parameter MaxTorque in instruction FCRefSprTorque.
Message.Actions: Change the parameter MaxTorque in instruction FCRefSprTorque to a value larger than zero.

Message.Title: Error FCRefLine, FCRefRot or FCRefCircle
Message.Description: The parameter Distance in instruction FCRefLine or instruction FCRefRot and the parameters Radius and Speed in instruction FCRefCircle have to be larger than zero.
Message.Actions: Change the parameters above according to the manual.

Message.Title: Parameter error in FCRefSpiral
Message.Description: Not allowed parameter value used in function FCRefSpiral.
Message.Causes: Error in parameter values of function FCRefSpiral.
Message.Actions: Modify the parameter values in function FCRefSpiral.

Message.Title: Parameter error in FCGetProcessData
Message.Description: Failed to retrieve process information.
Message.Causes: Using the optional parameter DataAtTrigTime in instruction FCGetProcessData. If no trig has occurred this error is reported.
Message.Actions: Remove the optional parameter.

Message.Title: Force sensor not setup
Message.Description: Error in the force sensor parameters.
Message.Actions: Check the force sensor configuration parameters.

Message.Title: Parameter error in FCCondAdvanced
Message.Description: Error in parameter LogicCond in instruction FCCondAdvanced.
Message.Actions: Modify the parameter LogicCond in instruction FCCondAdvanced.

Message.Title: Parameter error in FCCondTime
Message.Description: Error in parameter Time in instruction FCCondTime.
Message.Actions: Change the parameter Time in instruction FCCondTime to a value larger than zero.

Message.Title: Error in force control box definition
Message.Description: An error in the parameter Box in either FCCondPos or FCSupvPos.
Message.Actions: Change the parameter Box in either FCCondPos or FCSupvPos.

Message.Title: Error in force control cylinder definition
Message.Description: An error in the parameter Cylinder in either FCCondPos or FCSupvPos.
Message.Actions: Change the parameter Cylinder in either FCCondPos or FCSupvPos.

Message.Title: Error in force control sphere definition
Message.Description: An error in the parameter Sphere in either FCCondPos or FCSupvPos.
Message.Actions: Change the parameter Sphere in either FCCondPos or FCSupvPos.

Message.Title: Error in force control cone definition
Message.Description: An error in the parameters for either FCCondOrient or FCSupvOrient.
Message.Actions: Change the parameters in either FCCondOrient or FCSupvOrient.

Message.Title: Joints outside limits in force control
Message.Description: One or more joints are outside their working range in force control.
Message.Actions: Modify the program to avoid the physical joint limits.

Message.Title: Force control supervision error
Message.Description:
The user specified supervision has trigged. The type is .
Types:
1: TCP position
2: Tool orientation
3: TCP speed
4: Reorientation speed
5: Force
6: Torque
7: Teach TCP speed
8: Teach Reorientation speed
Message.Actions:
Deactivate force control.
Modify the supervision or the program.

Message.Title: Motor temperature error
Message.Description: Motor temperature for joint is too high.
Message.Consequences: It is not possible to continue until the motor has cooled down.

Message.Title: Test signal error
Message.Description: Definition of a test signal failed for , axis on channel .
Message.Causes:
The Mechanical Unit is not active.
The test signal number does not correspond to an actual test signal.
The channel number is too high.

Message.Title: Synchronization ID Warning
Message.Description: Two consecutive synchronized move instructions in have the same synchronization ID value .
Message.Consequences: If the ID value is repeated for more than one move instruction it can be very difficult to keep track of which move instructions are synchronized. This can, for example, cause problems when modifying positions.
Message.Actions: Change the synchronized move instruction in so that it has a unique synchronization ID value.

Message.Title: Software Equalizing Not Allowed
Message.Description: It is not possible to run Software Equalizing since Independent Move is active.
Message.Actions: Make sure independent move is not active when executing a Software Equalizing servo spot.

Message.Title: Independent Move not allowed
Message.Description: It is not possible to execute an Independent Move when Software Equalizing is active.
Message.Actions: Make sure Software Equalizing is off when executing an Independent Gun Move.

Message.Title: Number of move instruction mismatch
Message.Description:
Using the path recorder within synchronised motion requires:
That Tool offset must be present for all or none cooperating program tasks.
That all cooperating program tasks move backwards/forwards the same number of move instructions.
Message.Actions:
Verify that the all tasks or none of the tasks use the optional argument Tool Offset.
Verify that the pathrec identifier moving towards are at the same position in all tasks within the synchronised block.

Message.Title: Failed to read data from encoder card
Message.Description: The system has failed to read data from one encoder card.
Message.Consequences: The tracking accuracy during acceleration and deceleration might be reduced.
Message.Causes: Wrong unit name has probably been specified in the process parameter for
Message.Actions:
1) Check that the correct unit name is specified in the process parameter
eio unit name for

Message.Title: Ordered force reference is too large
Message.Description: The ordered force reference is larger than the configured maximum value.
Message.Consequences: The ordered force reference has been reduced to the configured value.
Message.Actions: To allow a larger reference force the system parameters need to be updated. Note that there is an absolute limit of force reference size that depends on the robot type.

Message.Title: Ordered torque reference is too large
Message.Description: The ordered torque reference is larger than the configured maximum value.
Message.Consequences: The ordered torque has been reduced to the configured maximum value.
Message.Actions: To allow a larger reference torque the system parameters need to be updated.

Message.Title: Ordered MaxForce is too large
Message.Description: The parameter MaxForce in instruction FCRefSprForce is larger than the configured maximum value.
Message.Consequences: The parameter MaxForce has been reduced to the configured maximum value.
Message.Actions: To allow a larger value the system parameters need to be updated.

Message.Title: Ordered MaxTorque is too large
Message.Description: The parameter MaxTorque in instruction FCRefSprTorque is larger than the configured maximum value.
Message.Consequences: The parameter MaxTorque has been reduced to the configured maximum value.
Message.Actions: To allow a larger value the system parameters need to be updated.

Message.Title: Close to singularity when in force control
Message.Description: Close to singularity when in force control mode for robot .
Message.Actions: Modify path away from the singularity or change to joint interpolation.

Message.Title: Path Recorder on StorePath level not allowed
Message.Description: The Path Recorder can only be used on base path level. The Path Recorder has been stopped.
Message.Actions: Stop Path Recorder before StorePath, restart it after RestoPath.

Message.Title: Brake release error
Message.Description: Too large position error of joint after brake release.
Message.Actions: Try once more. Check cables. Check hardware. Check tuning if error on additional axis.

Message.Title: Brake release time out
Message.Description: Joint was not in position after max time for brake release.
Message.Actions: Try once more. Check cables. Check hardware. Check tuning if error on additional axis.

Message.Title: SyncMoveOn failed
Message.Description: Starting synchronized movements failed due to an internal error.
Message.Consequences: It is not possible to restart the programs from the current position.
Message.Actions: Move the program pointers and try again.

Message.Title: Axis in current vector mode
Message.Description: Warning: Joint is configured in data as a current vector axis. Drive system will be disconnected for this axis during normal operation.
Message.Actions:
Run service program to activate the current vector.
Set configuration data for the DRIVE SYSTEM parameter current_vector_on to FALSE, for normal operation..

Message.Title: Reference Error
Message.Description: An error has occurred in the reference calculation. Internal status .
Message.Consequences: The controller goes to Motors Off
Message.Actions:
Check the error logs for previous errors that could be causing this problem.
Try to restart the program possibly after moving the program pointer.
Restart the controller.
